pull.title: wallet: Use correct effective value when checking target
pull.body:
Fixes #26185. The following assert failed because it was not checked in the parent function.

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/2bd9aa5a44b88c866c4d98f8a7bf7154049cba31/src/wallet/coinselection.cpp#L391

events.body: @1440000bytes could you check if this fixes your issue? Thanks.

> Also includes a quick refactor.

Generally, we avoid throwing "quick refactors" into bug fixes. Especially if they are going to be backported. Or, at least the refactor should be a separate commit, so if it doesn't need backporting, it doesn't have to be.

> Generally, we avoid throwing "quick refactors" into bug fixes.

Alright, removed.
Added a unit test.

@aureleoules  I want to clarify one thing:

Is this a bug only on Windows or other platforms? If its a bug on some linux distro as well it will be easier for me to test

> @aureleoules I want to clarify one thing:
> 
> Is this a bug only on Windows or other platforms? If its a bug on some linux distro as well it will be easier for me to test

Or maybe that should be job of testers.. Give me one day I will test it.
This is a logic bug in the wallet. It's entirely platform independent.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#25729](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25729) (wallet: Check max transaction weight in CoinSelection by aureleoules)
* [#25685](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25685) (wallet: Faster transaction creation by removing pre-set-inputs fetching responsibility from Coin Selection by furszy)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

I don't understand whats happening in this issue. I compiled PR branch and tested it on Windows, it fixes the previous error and bitcoind or bitcoin-qt does not crash. However, returns "insufficient funds".

@sipa said this is platform independent but I tried to run the same command on Fedora with v24.0rc1 and it returns PSBT with a change:

Windows (PR Branch):

```
bitcoin-cli listunspent

[
  {
    "txid": "e911734bf711009dd6057c88bc598df2d31c18d1cc6bd6c790a704b519d77e68",
    "vout": 0,
    "address": "2N7uBTqqQ99ArbgmBuw2AANsf24bMVdYxgp",
    "label": "",
    "redeemScript": "522102de62833c851509cf13c0c63e0dc3ef7b74f7d86b17e9090fab68c09830cb2f2e2103cf11a2bc1371dad3691bce59e37d85b12aae6b030b533d4e7c5aedeb47a5ec0e52ae",
    "scriptPubKey": "a914a0bf75baf8f3a4ae761c2faa2516b8540e993d8987",
    "amount": 0.00100000,
    "confirmations": 595,
    "spendable": false,
    "solvable": true,
    "desc": "sh(multi(2,[aa130fed]02de62833c851509cf13c0c63e0dc3ef7b74f7d86b17e9090fab68c09830cb2f2e,[00890d8d]03cf11a2bc1371dad3691bce59e37d85b12aae6b030b533d4e7c5aedeb47a5ec0e))#j8w6g6zg",
    "parent_descs": [
    ],
    "safe": true
  }
]

bitcoin-cli walletcreatefundedpsbt "[{\"txid\":\"e911734bf711009dd6057c88bc598df2d31c18d1cc6bd6c790a704b519d77e68\",\"vout\":0}]" "[{\"tb1q9fxp2p0sm93jdlul8v3svzn7x69zcd9ljsgans\":\"0.0009\"}]"

Insufficient funds (code -4)
```

Fedora (v24.0rc1):

```
bitcoin-cli listunspent

[
  {
    "txid": "e911734bf711009dd6057c88bc598df2d31c18d1cc6bd6c790a704b519d77e68",
    "vout": 0,
    "address": "2N7uBTqqQ99ArbgmBuw2AANsf24bMVdYxgp",
    "label": "",
    "redeemScript": "522102de62833c851509cf13c0c63e0dc3ef7b74f7d86b17e9090fab68c09830cb2f2e2103cf11a2bc1371dad3691bce59e37d85b12aae6b030b533d4e7c5aedeb47a5ec0e52ae",
    "scriptPubKey": "a914a0bf75baf8f3a4ae761c2faa2516b8540e993d8987",
    "amount": 0.00100000,
    "confirmations": 595,
    "spendable": false,
    "solvable": true,
    "desc": "sh(multi(2,[aa130fed]02de62833c851509cf13c0c63e0dc3ef7b74f7d86b17e9090fab68c09830cb2f2e,[00890d8d]03cf11a2bc1371dad3691bce59e37d85b12aae6b030b533d4e7c5aedeb47a5ec0e))#j8w6g6zg",
    "parent_descs": [
    ],
    "safe": true
  }
]

bitcoin-cli  walletcreatefundedpsbt "[{\"txid\":\"e911734bf711009dd6057c88bc598df2d31c18d1cc6bd6c790a704b519d77e68\",\"vout\":0}]" "[{\"tb1q9fxp2p0sm93jdlul8v3svzn7x69zcd9ljsgans\":\"0.0009\"}]"

{
  "psbt": "",
  "fee": 0.00000330,
  "changepos": 0
}

```

@1440000bytes  So IIUC you have 1 coin worth 0.001 BTC (as shown by your `listunspent`). You tried to create a transaction paying 0.0009 using `walletcreatefundedpsbt`, passing that coin in manually. Since you specified an input manually, `m_allow_other_inputs` is false.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/f59e91511a3aa8b2770eeec7034ddc1a9dec918b/src/wallet/rpc/spend.cpp#L1659-L1663
This needs to fund the payment and the fees for the transaction, including the cost to spend the coin. 0.001 covers the payment and non-input fees, but not the cost to spend. So it is indeed the case that the wallet has insufficient funds.

cause of the crash and why the fix works:

`SelectionResult::AddInput` changes `m_use_effective` to true:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/f59e91511a3aa8b2770eeec7034ddc1a9dec918b/src/wallet/spend.cpp#L584
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/f59e91511a3aa8b2770eeec7034ddc1a9dec918b/src/wallet/coinselection.cpp#L441-L445
`GetSelectedValue()` is 0.001 and `GetSelectedEffectiveValue()` is something less than 0.0009.
So this condition doesn't hit:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/f59e91511a3aa8b2770eeec7034ddc1a9dec918b/src/wallet/spend.cpp#L585
But the assertion does, since `selected_effective_value` is something less than 0.0009.

concept ACK 1e60f5d4d5e9990e00ddbaa0cfacf3c5731d73f9
whether or not it's the cause of the crash in #26185, this is a bug fix, as AFAICT it's incorrect to not use effective value here

> I don't understand whats happening in this issue. I compiled PR branch and tested it on Windows, it fixes the previous error and bitcoind or bitcoin-qt does not crash. However, returns "insufficient funds".
> 
> @sipa said this is platform independent but I tried to run the same command on Fedora with v24.0rc1 and it returns PSBT with a change:

@1440000bytes: I missed this at first, but could you confirm that the first output you posted is resulting from running `PR/26203` (this branch) on Windows, and the second output is from running `v24.0rc1` on Fedora?

Concept ACK.

The assert can also be reproduced by adjusting the amount in the psbt just between the regimes where it succeeds and the regime with insufficient funds. E.g. on an empty regtest datadir:
```
./bitcoind -regtest -fallbackfee=0.001
./bitcoin-cli -regtest -generate 101
./bitcoin-cli -regtest listunspent -> use txid in next call
./bitcoin-cli -regtest walletcreatefundedpsbt "[{\"txid\":\"<txid>\",\"vout\":0}]" "[{\"<some address>\":\"49.9999\"}]"
```
will lead to a crash on master (which is fixed by this PR).

> This needs to fund the payment and the fees for the transaction, including the cost to spend the coin. 0.001 covers the payment and non-input fees, but not the cost to spend. So it is indeed the case that the wallet has insufficient funds.

What is cost to spend?

> @1440000bytes: I missed this at first, but could you confirm that the first output you posted is resulting from running PR/26203 (this branch) on Windows, and the second output is from running v24.0rc1 on Fedora?

Yes

and both have same config:

```
# Windows

signet=1
txindex=1

signet.rpcport=18332
rpcuser=user
rpcpassword=pass

fallbackfee=0.0004


# Fedora

signet=1
txindex=1

[signet] 
rpcport=18332
rpcuser=user
rpcpassword=pass

fallbackfee=0.0004

```
Concept ACK, have a couple small improvement suggestions:

events.message: test: Check external coin effective value is used in CoinSelection

events.body:
Thank you @Xekyo @glozow @mzumsande for the reviews, I addressed your comments. Thanks @1440000bytes for testing.
push diff here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/1e60f5d4d..d0d9cf7aea2ff36a14a19e6999400e4070b7b0c9
Overall the change looks correct to me. I was trying to backport the test to see where the bug was introduced, but didn't succeed due to too many refactors. Is it a regression from 23.0 or not?
reACK d0d9cf7aea2ff36a14a19e6999400e4070b7b0c9

ACK d0d9cf7a

Happily, #25685 fixes this too. I introduced the same preset-inputs result selection target check inside aa5fdbad for another reason there. So.. the unit test introduced here is also passing there without having to cherry-pick the bug fix 76b79c1a.

> Happily, https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25685 fixes this too.

That's good to hear, though I think this is more appropriate for a backport.
#26242
Post-merge ACK d0d9cf7aea2ff36a14a19e6999400e4070b7b0c9
Post merge ACK d0d9cf7aea2ff36a14a19e6999400e4070b7b0c9

@@ -922,5 +922,52 @@ BOOST_AUTO_TEST_CASE(effective_value_test)
     BOOST_CHECK_EQUAL(output5.GetEffectiveValue(), nValue); // The effective value should be equal to the absolute value if input_bytes is -1
 }
 
+BOOST_AUTO_TEST_CASE(SelectCoins_effective_value_test)
+{
+    // Test that effective value is used in coin selection
+    // This test creates an external coin with a high effective value
+    // The coin will not be selected because its effective value is less than the target
